definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards

sentences.english: With so many college studentscoming out at a time, many graduates havedifficulties in finding suitable jobs.
sentences.chinese: 随着大学生相继毕业，许多应届生很难找到工作。

sentences.english: Leb?uf and Zola retired in one month.
sentences.chinese: 勒伯夫和佐拉在同一月内相继退役。

sentences.english: said Goddio, The exhibition will tour several other North American cities.
sentences.chinese: 该展览也会相继在北美其它一些城市进行。

sentences.english: You will be quite friendly with your enemy when you both die.
sentences.chinese: 当你和仇敌相继死去，彼此即彻底化敌为友了。

sentences.english: The claim was eventually retracted, one of several such retractions over the past several days.
sentences.chinese: 传闻最终收回，过去几天诸如此类的传闻相继收回。

sentences.english: Every successive element of fluid undergoes the throttling process in a continuous stream.
sentences.chinese: 在连续的流动中，每一流体元相继地经历节流过程。

sentences.english: This represents successive stages of transfer of amplitude to later lobes .
sentences.chinese: 这代表振幅向后面波瓣传递的相继各阶段。

sentences.english: In Azerbaijan, detection of the virus has coincided with die-offs of domestic birds.
sentences.chinese: 在阿塞拜疆，病毒的发现与家禽的相继死亡同时发生。

sentences.english: From then on, many medical schools and various classics on medicine were brought into being in succession, each having its own strong points.
sentences.chinese: 自此许多不同的学派及经典著作相继出现，各抒己见。

sentences.english: Recently, it is being used in America and Europe too.
sentences.chinese: 最近，在欧美也被相继引入。

sentences.english: Yes, the Crusades died off, but it was regaining popularity.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们虽然相继死去，但是十字军的阴魂一直未散。

sentences.english: The investigation uncovered no reports of poultry die-offs in the market.
sentences.chinese: 调查揭示无市场上家禽相继死亡的报告。

sentences.english: In recent years, the Central government promulgated a series of policies to promote Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 近年来国家扶支持中医药的政策相继出台。

sentences.english: The die-off takes just one to three weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这次大约蜜蜂相继死去只要一周到三周的时间。

sentences.english: The inversing design of long-stroke sequential turbocharging (STC) diesel engine is discussed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文对某长行程相继增压柴油机进行逆向设计。

sentences.english: In the same period, the Chinese national textile industry also had grown in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 同一时期，中国民族棉纺织业在上海也相继发展壮大。

definition: in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit
early or late/priority/in succession/one after another
to take the lead/to show initiative
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
to enumerate in detail/to explain clearly
